titles.title: A bill to provide that political candidates meet certain requirements in advertising.

action.text: Referred to House Committee on Energy and Commerce.
Referred to Subcommittee on Telecommunications and Finance.

bill.summary: 12/18/1987--Introduced. Amends the Communications Act of 1934 to prohibit a legally qualified candidate from receiving the lowest unit charge for the use of any broadcasting station for a political announcement or advertisement, unless such candidate is identifiable during one-third of the time of such announcement or advertisement.
